title: Compatibility of Real-Rooted Polynomials with Mixed Signs
abstract:
We characterize compatible families of real-rooted polynomials, allowing both
positive and negative leading coefficients. Our characterization naturally
generalizes the same-sign characterization used by Chudnovsky and Seymour in
their famous 2007 paper proving the real-rootedness of independence polynomials
of claw-free graphs, thus fully settling a question left open in their paper.
Our methods are generally speaking elementary, utilizing mainly linear algebra
and the established theory of interlacing polynomials, with a bit of invariant
theory.
